com.bazaarvoice
Class DisplayParams

java.lang.Object
  com.bazaarvoice.BazaarParams
      com.bazaarvoice.DisplayParams

public class DisplayParams
extends BazaarParams

Handles the parameters for a display request.
Use of this class will rely on knowledge of the Bazaarvoice API. You should use this site as a reference for which parameters to pass using this class.

Created on 7/9/12. Copyright (c) 2012 BazaarVoice. All rights reserved.

Author:
Bazaarvoice Engineering

Method Detail

addAttribute

public void addAttribute(java.lang.String attribute)
Add an "Attribute" parameter to the request.

Parameters:
attribute - the new attribute

addInclude

public void addInclude(IncludeType include)
Add an "Include" parameter to the request.

Parameters:
include - the new include

addSort

public void addSort(java.lang.String attribute,
                    boolean asc)
Add an attribute to the "Sort" parameter list. Sorts by the schema of the given attribute.

Parameters:
attribute - the attribute name
asc - true for ascending, false for descending

addStats

public void addStats(java.lang.String type)
Add a content type to the "Stats" parameter. Retrieves statistics for that type of content along with the response.

Parameters:
type - the type of content for which to add stats

addSearch

public void addSearch(java.lang.String searchString)
Add a single term to the "Search" parameter. Limits the results to match a search string.

Note: Be sure to remove any leading or trailing white space as it could interfere with search performance.

Usage:
This is the recommended way to add search terms to a request. Although, if you prefer to add them all at once, see setSearch(List).

Parameters:
searchString - the string to search for

addSortType

public void addSortType(java.lang.String type,
                        java.lang.String attribute,
                        boolean asc)
Add a "Sort_[TYPE]" parameter to the request. Sorts any included content by the schema of the given attribute.

Parameters:
type - the type to sort: comments, reviews, etc
attribute - the attribute name
asc - true for ascending, false for descending

addLimitType

public void addLimitType(java.lang.String type,
                         int limitVal)
Add a "Limit_[TYPE]" parameter to the request. Limits any included content to a maximum amount.

Parameters:
type - the type to limit: comments, reviews, etc
limitVal - the number to limit

setOffset

public void setOffset(int offset)
Add an "Offset" parameter to the request. Changes the index at which to begin returning results.

Parameters:
offset - new offset

setLimit

public void setLimit(int limit)
Add a "Limit" parameter to the request. Limits the maximum amount of results. The default is 100.

Parameters:
limit - new limit

addFilterType

public void addFilterType(IncludeType filterType,
                          java.lang.String attribute,
                          Equality equality,
                          java.lang.String[] values)
Add a "Filter_[TYPE]" parameter to the request. Filters any included content by the schema of the given attribute, Equality type, and values.

Allows multiple values.

Parameters:
filterType - the type to filter, i.e. Comments for Reviews. If null this is a regular filter
attribute - what to filter on, i.e. Rating or ProductId
equality - comparison for filtering, greater than, equals etc
values - the values for the filter

addFilterType

public void addFilterType(IncludeType filterType,
                          java.lang.String attribute,
                          Equality equality,
                          java.lang.String value)
Add a "Filter_[TYPE]" parameter to the request. Filters any included content by the schema of the given attribute, Equality type, and value.

Allows only one value.

Parameters:
filterType - the type to filter, i.e. Comments for Reviews. If null this is a regular filter
attribute - what to filter on, i.e. Rating or ProductId
equality - comparison for filtering, greater than, equals etc
value - the value for the filter

addFilterType

public void addFilterType(IncludeType filterType,
                          java.lang.String attribute,
                          java.lang.String value)
Add a "Filter_[TYPE]" parameter to the request. Filters any included content by the schema of the given attribute, and value.

Equality is set to "equals", and only one value is allowed.

Parameters:
filterType - can be any included nested content. i.e. Comments for Reviews. If null this is a regular filter
attribute - what to filter on, i.e. Rating or ProductId
value - the value for the filter

addFilter

public void addFilter(java.lang.String attribute,
                      Equality equality,
                      java.lang.String[] values)
Add a "Filter" parameter to the request. Same as calling addFilterType(null, attribute, equality, values);

Allows multiple values.

Parameters:
attribute - what to filter on, i.e. Rating or ProductId
equality - comparison for filtering, greater than, equals etc
values - the values for the filter

addFilter

public void addFilter(java.lang.String attribute,
                      Equality equality,
                      java.lang.String value)
Add a "Filter" parameter to the request. Same as calling addFilterType(null, attribute, equality, value);

Allows only one value.

Parameters:
attribute - what to filter on, i.e. Rating or ProductId
equality - comparison for filtering, greater than, equals etc
value - the value for the filter

addFilter

public void addFilter(java.lang.String attribute,
                      java.lang.String value)
Add a "Filter" parameter to the request. Same as calling addFilterType(null, attribute, Equality.EQUALS, value);

Equality is set to "equals", and only one value is allowed.

Parameters:
attribute - what to filter on, i.e. Rating or ProductId
value - the value for the filter

toURL in class BazaarParams
Parameters:
url - the base url to append to
Returns:
the full url

getSearch

public java.util.List<java.lang.String> getSearch()
Get the list of search terms.

Returns:
a list of terms

setSearch

public void setSearch(java.util.List<java.lang.String> search)
Set the list of words to be used in the "Search" parameter manually. Be sure to remove any leading or trailing white space from each word as it may interfere with search performance.

Usage:
This is for setting all of the search terms at once and relys on the user encoding the terms correctly. Recommended usage is to add terms one by one using addSearch(String).

Parameters:
search - the list of search terms

getFilters

public java.util.List<java.lang.String> getFilters()
Get the list of filters.

Returns:
a list of filters.

setFilters

public void setFilters(java.util.List<java.lang.String> filters)
Set the list of "Filter" parameters manually.

Usage:
Recommended usage is to add filters one by one using addFilter(String, Equality, String[]) or one of the other overridden methods.

Parameters:
filters - the list of filters
